{{short description|American singer/songwriter}} {{otheruses}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Riley Green | image = Welcome Riley Green (7) (cropped).jpg | caption = Green in 2022 | image_upright = | image_size = | landscape = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1988|10|18}} | birth_place = [[Jacksonville, Alabama]], U.S. | origin = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = {{flatlist| * Singer * songwriter }} | instrument = {{flatlist| * Vocals * guitar }} | years_active = 2013–present | label = [[Nashville Harbor Records & Entertainment|Nashville Harbor]] }} '''Riley Green''' (born October 18, 1988) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. Signed to [[Nashville Harbor Records & Entertainment]] (formerly BMLG) since 2019, he has released two albums: ''[[Different 'Round Here]]'' in 2019 and ''[[Ain't My Last Rodeo]]'' in 2023. Green has charted four top-20 hits on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]] charts: "[[There Was This Girl]]", "[[I Wish Grandpas Never Died]]", "[[Half of Me (Thomas Rhett and Riley Green song)|Half of Me]]" (with [[Thomas Rhett]]), and "[[Different 'Round Here (song)|Different 'Round Here]]" (with [[Luke Combs]]). ==Music career== Before he was a recording artist, Green was a Division 1 FCS Quarterback on the [[Jacksonville State University]] football team. Green was also a contestant on the [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]] reality show ''Redneck Island''. He released a self-titled EP in 2013, followed by additional EPs in 2015, 2016, and 2017. In 2018, he signed to the [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine Label Group]].{{cite web | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/riley-green-mn0003672594/biography | title=Riley Green biography | work=Allmusic | accessdate=October 17, 2018}}{{cite web | url=https://www.bigmachinelabelgroup.com/news/bmlg-records-signs-riley-green | title=BMLG RECORDS SIGNS RILEY GREEN | work=Big Machine Label Group | date=22 February 2018 | accessdate=May 4, 2019}} Billy Dukes of ''[[Taste of Country]]'' reviewed "There Was This Girl" favorably, comparing its theme to "[[Chicks Dig It]]" by [[Chris Cagle]] and noting the more [[neotraditional country]] influence compared to Green's peers.{{cite web | url=http://tasteofcountry.com/riley-green-there-was-this-girl/ | title=Don't quit on Riley Green's 'There Was This Girl' [Listen] | work=Taste of Country | date=9 August 2018 | accessdate=October 17, 2018}} The song charted on [[Country Airplay]], and a music video was shot in October 2018.{{cite web | url=http://tasteofcountry.com/riley-green-there-was-this-girl-video/ | title=Riley Green's 'There Was This Girl' video comes together thanks to screaming fans | work=Taste of Country | date=15 October 2018 | accessdate=October 17, 2018}} In April 2019, Green announced the release of his second single, "In Love by Now", co-written with [[Rhett Akins]], [[Ben Hayslip]], and [[Marv Green]], and released an accompanying music video shot in Belize.{{cite web | url=https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2019/04/15/riley-green-announces-new-single-in-love-by-now-following-his-first-1/ | title=Riley Green Announces New Single "In Love By Now", following his first #1 | work=Whiskey Riff | date=15 April 2019 | accessdate=May 4, 2019}}{{cite magazine | url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/8507760/riley-green-in-love-by-now-video | title=Riley Green's 'In Love By Now' Video: Exclusive | magazine=Billboard | accessdate=May 4, 2019}} "[[I Wish Grandpas Never Died]]" was released in August 2019 as the third single from Green's debut album, ''[[Different 'Round Here]]'', which was released on September 20, 2019.{{cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/riley-green-different-round-here-new-album/|title=Riley Green Announces Different 'Round Here Album|author=Billy Dukes|date=August 2, 2019|work=Taste of Country|accessdate=August 6, 2019}} The Academy of Country Music presented Riley Green with the New Male Artist of the Year Award for 2019.web|url= https://www.acmcountry.com/winners?awardTitle=&awardCategory=New+Male+Artist+of+the+Year&awardYear=2019&actionButton=Submit He collaborated on a song with [[Justin Moore]] for his 2023 album, ''Stray Dog''.{{cite web | url=https://www.whiskeyriff.com/2023/03/28/justin-moore-says-collaboration-with-riley-green-everybody-get-along-is-dropping-this-friday/ | title=Justin Moore Says Collaboration With Riley Green, "Everybody Get Along," Is Dropping This Friday | publisher=Whiskey Riff | date=March 28, 2023 | accessdate=April 14, 2023}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable
